business.headline: Should investors be cautious of IT stocks amid H-1B visa changes?With ongoing changes in visa fees and policies, analysts say the outlook for the sector has turned uncertain in the short run.

How NPCI powers half the world's digital payments on just Rs 500 croreNational Payments Corporation of India handles 46% of the world's digital transactions. UPI alone processes 3,729 transactions per second.

Cabinet clears Rs 1,866 crore productivity bonus for railway staffRailway employees are in for festive cheer as the Union Cabinet has approved a productivity-linked bonus, benefiting lakhs of staff members.

Should you have two credit cards? Here's what you need to knowCredit card usage is on the rise in India, and many people are wondering if having a second card makes sense. From rewards to financial flexibility, here's what you should know before applying for another card.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as profit booking continues; Tata Motors falls over 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 386.47 points to 81,715.63, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 112.60 points to close at 25,056.90. Broader market indices also ended lower, with sectoral breadth largely negative, except for pharma stocks, which managed modest gains.

Why your cashless insurance claim isn't always 'cashless'Cashless claims promise convenience, but long delays, unclear policies, and unjust deductions often leave patients stressed. Understanding your rights and navigating the system proactively can prevent financial and medical headaches.

PPF, SCSS, SSY: Are Small Saving Scheme interest rates set to change?As the September 30 announcement approaches, savers are wondering if interest rates on popular small saving schemes like PPF, SCSS, and Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) will change. Here's what you need to know.

How to buy gold the right way this festive seasonGold shopping is a festive tradition for many Indian families, but with rising prices and endless options, making the right choice can feel tricky. Here's how you can buy gold the right way this season.

H-1B crackdown cracks the rupee. Know why INR hit an all-time lowEconomists estimate that remittances, the money Indians abroad send back, could drop by around $400 million. For a country that relies on foreign money flowing in, that's significant.

Union Cabinet likely to clear bonus for railway staff soon: Government sourcesThe bonus, usually extended to non-gazetted railway employees, is meant to recognise their contribution to the efficiency and performance of one of India's most crucial transport networks.

Income tax audit 2025: Deadlines, rules and penalties you must knowThe clock is ticking for taxpayers who fall under the audit bracket. With the income tax audit deadline for FY 2024–25 just around the corner, here's a quick look at key dates, rules, and penalties.

Confused between Swiggy and Eternal stock? Here's what experts suggestMarket experts say the two companies are in very different positions when it comes to earnings visibility and investor confidence.

entertainment.headline: Salman on fatherhood, Aamir on divorce: How superstars made Two Much too much Excited for 'Two Much with Kajol and Twinkle' premiere? From embracing fatherhood to bonding after divorce, here's a glimpse into the candid revelations made by superstars Aamir and Salman Khan on the talk show.

Zubeen Garg's last film is a musical love story and fans will love it, says wife Late singer Zubeen Garg's wife, Garima, shared her resolve to complete his last film 'Roi Roi Binale'. Despite the sadness of his death, she is dedicated to honouring his legacy and fulfilling his unfinished work for his fans.

Shah Rukh Khan's National Award for Jawan: Three decades too late? Shah Rukh Khan wins his first National Award in 2025 for 'Jawan'. More than a single performance, the honour marks a long-overdue recognition of SRK's three-decade legacy, iconic films, and unmatched cultural impact.

Sunny Leone reacts to Anurag Kashyap, Vikramaditya Motwane's AI criticism Actor Sunny Leone recently addressed the concerns around the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in cinema. She also highlighted the relevance of AI-driven cinema in the entertainment industry.

Exclusive: Did Anurag Kashyap follow Saiyaara playbook for Nishaanchi leads? In an exclusive chat with India Today, filmmaker-actor Anurag Kashyap revealed why he kept newcomers away from interviews ahead of 'Nishaanchi's' release. He praised Aaishvary Thackeray's impressive debut while brushing aside nepotism concerns.

Parineeti Chopra's playful anniversary wish for Raghav Chadha has a Paris twist Actor Parineeti Chopra wished her politician husband, Raghav Chadha, on their second wedding anniversary with a dash of humour. The reference to Paris in their social media post was unmissable. Check it out.

Vikrant Massey: Manoj Kumar Sharma is family, stood by me at National Awards Vikrant Massey's Best Actor win for '12th Fail' at the 71st National Film Awards was a heartfelt celebration shared with the real-life IPS officer, Manoj Kumar Sharma, who inspired the film. The actor, while rooted in portraying the common man, told us that he is eager to explore diverse roles and entertain audiences in new ways.

KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan jokes about Pakistanis smashing TVs after losing to India In the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', host Amitabh Bachchan entertained all with a joke about Pakistani fans after a cricket match.

Anushka Sharma, Virat Kohli enjoy London outing with son Akaay. See viral pics Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli, who have been staying in London lately, were clicked enjoying strolling on the streets. The couple was accompanied by their son, Akaay.

One Piece Season 2: First look at Loguetown out crew sets sail for Grand Line Netflix teases new locations for 'One Piece' Season 2, beginning with Loguetown. Official synopsis highlights peril and discovery in the Grand Line.

Vikrant Massey on National Award win: To be mentioned in same breath as SRK... Vikrant Massey celebrated his first National Award for '12th Fail', calling it a "dream" to share the honour with Shah Rukh Khan, who also won his first for 'Jawan'. The actor recalled a heartfelt moment with SRK and Rani Mukerji as they cherished their medals together.

Exclusive: Sunny Leone sets trend with AI-driven feature film 'Kaur vs KORE' Sunny Leone is set to star in 'Kaur vs KORE', a pioneering AI-powered film. The movie blends futuristic technology with human emotions and highlights digital safety concerns.

Main Hoon Na's Amrita Rao recalls Shah Rukh Khan's advice on choosing films Actor Amrita Rao shared valuable career advice she received from Shah Rukh Khan. She said on a recent podcast that the actor's philosophy guided her selective approach to signing films. What was his advice? Read on.

How humanised backstories of demons made Demon Slayer a global hit Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle Part 1 – Akaza Returns' has become a global blockbuster, and one key reason is that it demonstrates not only the Demon Slayers' strength but also how demons reflect human vices.

Sholay restored version to premiere in Sydney with original ending as centrepiece The newly restored version of 'Sholay' will be screened as centrepiece at The Indian Film Festival of Sydney. The restoration includes the original ending and involved archival discoveries in London and Mumbai.

Anupam Kher says he was sad after Saiyaara fever wiped out Tanvi: The Great Actor Anupam Kher recently opened up on being heartbroken over his directorial 'Tanvi: The Great' being sidelined by 'Saiyaara'. He revealed how he had to borrow money from friends after the financier backed out of the film at the last moment.

Sai Pallavi trolled for wearing swimsuit, because saree girl can't be a beach babe Sai Pallavi was trolled for wearing a swimsuit on the beach, with fans unable to see beyond her saree-clad image. The outrage exposes society's hypocrisy, patriarchy, and the fragile idea of culture that refuses women the freedom to just be human.

Samyuktha Hedge claims Baseer is not a good boyfriend amid Bigg Boss 19 link-ups Actor Samyuktha Hegde called her rumoured boyfriend Baseer Ali a bad boyfriend. The Bigg Boss 19 contestant has recently been linked to Nehal Chudasama and Farrhana Bhatt on 'Bigg Boss 19'. However, that doesn't stop Samyuktha from supporting him in the reality show.

Tamil actor Manikandan on his Kalaimamani win: We artistes work for recognition Tamil actor Manikandan has been awarded the prestigious Kalaimamani award by the Tamil Nadu government. The actor, in an exclusive interview with India Today, expressed happiness and a sense of responsibility upon receiving the honour.

general news.headline: 4 dead, 60 injured as Ladakh's statehood protests turn violent, curfew imposedThe call for a shutdown came after two of 15 people on a hunger strike, led by climate activist Sonam Wangchuk, since September 10 were shifted to a hospital due to deteriorating health.

Kashmir man who provided logistical support to Pahalgam terrorists arrestedPolice have arrested Mohammad Yousuf Kataria, a 26-year-old resident of Kulgam, for providing logistical support to the terrorists.

Come to my room: Delhi godman's indecent messages to women he 'molested'Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati reportedly summoned girls to his room late at night, threatened to reduce their marks or fail them if they did not comply, and lured some with promises of foreign trips.

IND vs BAN Live: Abhishek hits fifty, Dube fails at No.3India (IND) vs Bangladesh (BAN) Live Score, Asia Cup Super 4: Abhishek Sharma completes his fifty in 25 balls. India have hit 96 runs in the first 10 overs and are looking good for a huge total. After the dismissals of Shubman Gill and Shivam Dube, Suryakumar Yadav has come out at No.4.

What sparked Gen Z protests in Ladakh? Explained in 5 pointsThe agitation for Ladakh's statehood and inclusion in the Sixth Schedule in the capital Leh turned violent on Wednesday. Four people were killed and over 70 injured. This came even as protesters torched a BJP office and a CRPF van. Activist Sonam Wangchuk has called the protests a "Gen Z revolution". The BJP has slammed the Congress for the chaos.

1 dead after gunman opens fire at Dallas immigration office before taking own lifeMultiple people were wounded and killed in a shooting on Wednesday at a federal Immigration and Customs Enforcement field office in Dallas. The shooter was found dead on the roof of a nearby building.

CBSE Class 10, 12 datesheet 2026: Full tentative schedule releasedThe CBSE has released the tentative datesheet for Class 10 and 12 board exams 2026, giving students, teachers, and parents early clarity on the schedule.

How your wage, job site will play a role in Trump's new H-1B selection processThe Trump administration has proposed a major overhaul of the H-1B visa selection process, causing confusion and concern, especially among Indian techies.

Chaotic geopolitical jungle of 2025: Retreating Lion, Dancing Dragon, Reckless Bear, Rogue HyenaThe global geopolitical landscape in 2025 is a volatile multipolar arena marked by America's retreat, China's rise, and shifting alliances. India faces both challenges and opportunities in this unpredictable world order.
ULIPs & Mutual Funds: Why you need both for a balanced portfolioULIPs give you protection and discipline for the long haul, while mutual funds give you liquidity and flexibility for the near term.

Stop Russia's war or face most destructive arms race in history: Zelenskyy in UNZelenskyy accused Russian President Vladimir Putin of seeking to push the war beyond Ukraine's borders. He pointed to alleged violations of Nato airspace by Russian drones and jets as evidence of Moscow's wider ambitions.

Don't post, just mourn: Trolls attack Zubeen Garg's wife, strangers fight for herGarima Saikia Garg, the grieving wife of singer Zubeen Garg, urged fans for patience and defended his manager Siddharth Sarma amid suspicions surrounding his death. Her video, meant as a plea for peace, sparked backlash, with many accusing her of neglect or defending those responsible. Now, Garima has found huge support online.

Vikrant Massey on National Award win: To be mentioned in same breath as SRK...Vikrant Massey celebrated his first National Award for '12th Fail', calling it a "dream" to share the honour with Shah Rukh Khan, who also won his first for 'Jawan'. The actor recalled a heartfelt moment with SRK and Rani Mukerji as they cherished their medals together.

X must follow Indian laws: High Court rejects plea against Centre's takedown ordersThe Karnataka High Court said that X must comply with the country's laws and clarified that the constitutional protection of free speech under Article 19 is available only to Indian citizens, not foreign entities.

Noted Kannada author SL Bhyrappa dies, PM Modi mourns 'fearless, timeless thinker'SL Bhyrappa, the eminent Kannada author, passed away at 94 in Bengaluru. His death has drawn heartfelt tributes from Prime Minister Modi, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, and literary figures nationwide.

New H-1B fee could end 1.4 lakh jobs a year in US, says expertThe Trump administration's new $100,000 fee on H-1B visa applications could reduce immigrant work authorisations by over 66,000 annually, according to JPMorgan economists. Another expert warned the fee hike could dismantle the H-1B system, potentially eliminating up to 140,000 skilled jobs annually. Indian workers, who make up 71% of H-1B recipients, are likely to be hit the hardest.

Shah Rukh Khan's National Award for Jawan: Three decades too late?Shah Rukh Khan wins his first National Award in 2025 for 'Jawan'. More than a single performance, the honour marks a long-overdue recognition of SRK's three-decade legacy, iconic films, and unmatched cultural impact.

India with us: Zelenskyy fact-checks Trump on Russia warUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said "India is mostly with Ukraine", differing with his American counterpart, Donald Trump, who blamed New Delhi for "funding Russia". Zelenskyy also called for Europe's stronger ties with India to wean it off Russian energy.

Nijjar's successor, a Pannun aide, held in Canada for possession of illegal armsKhalistani extremist Inderjeet Singh Gosal has been arrested in Canada over illegal firearms' possession. An aide to designated terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun, Gosal organised Khalistan referendum rallies in Canada. He previously faced assault charges linked to a 2024 temple attack. His rise followed the 2023 killing of Hardeep Singh Nijjar.

Trump's H-1B move a lottery for UK, Europe? A reality check for Indian talentH-1B visa: After Trump's H-1B visa clampdown, several European nations are positioning themselves as a magnet for global talent. A closer look reveals that in many countries, immigration policies are becoming increasingly restrictive.

Viral video: Massive sinkhole opens near Bangkok hospital, swallows cars, power polesThe incident, which took place in the Thai capital's Samsen Road area, has been linked to the construction of a nearby railway station.

Durga Puja dampener? How rain-battered Kolkata is coping with the delugeAfter record-breaking overnight rain, Kolkata woke up to streets turned into lakes, traffic at a standstill and lives upended in the run-up to Durga Puja festivities

The outrage exposes society's hypocrisy, patriarchy, and the fragile idea of culture that refuses women the freedom to just be human.

Trump goes after H-1B visa, here is what Indian diaspora CEOs are sayingA lot of people have said many things about US President Donald Trump targeting H-1B visas. But one group, the group of Indian tech CEOs, is silent and their silence is now catching the attention of Indians on social media.

sports.headline: Mohun Bagan seek venue change for ACL match in Iran, citing player safety Mohun Bagan Super Giant, reigning Indian Super League champions, have formally requested the Asian Football Confederation to move their September 30 AFC Champions League 2 clash against Sepahan SC out of Iran, citing safety concerns.

Asia Cup: Why are Bangladesh playing second-string team vs India? Bangladesh field a second string team against India after Litton Das injury. The team makes four changes aiming to challenge India in a crucial Super 4 Asia Cup match.

KL Rahul flops as India A 194-all out, concede big lead to Australia A India A struggled with the bat on Day 2 of the second unofficial Test against Australia A, failing to capitalise after an expensive bowling performance on Day 1. B Sai Sudharsan's 75 was the lone bright spot as big guns, including KL Rahul and captain Dhruv Jurel, failed in Lucknow.

IND U19 vs AUS U19: Suryavanshi, Mhatre help India seal series with 51-run win India Under 19 defeated Australia Under 19 by 51 runs in the second youth ODI at Brisbane. Suryavanshi's record sixes and Mhatre's bowling spell secured India's unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.

Indian football team unlikely to get government nod for Asian Games 2026 The Indian sports ministry will only send athletes who have real chance of winning a medal at the Asian Games. The directive means that the Indian football team might not be allowed to play in the continental tournament.

Hours before Test squad announcement, Prasidh retires hurt vs Australia A Pacer Prasidh Krishna was forced to leave the field on Wednesday after sustaining a concussion from a blow to his helmet while batting for India A against Australia A on day two of the second unofficial Test.

IND vs BAN Live: Abhishek hits fifty, Dube fails at No.3 India (IND) vs Bangladesh (BAN) Live Score, Asia Cup Super 4: Abhishek Sharma completes his fifty in 25 balls. He and Shubman Gill gave India a rapid start in the powerplay after which Shubman was caught at long-on just outside of powerplay.

Abhishek Sharma solidifies top spot, Tilak, Suryakumar rise in T20I batting rankings India's Abhishek Sharma retains his top position in the ICC T20I batting rankings after impressive Asia Cup 2025 performances. Apart from him, captain Suryakumar Yadav and Tilak Varma also gained one spot each.

Shaheen Afridi opens up on Pakistan's gestures vs India: Each have their own opinions Shaheen Afridi has downplayed criticism of Pakistan's on-field gestures during the Asia Cup clash against India. He emphasised the team's focus on cricket and their push for a place in the final amid ongoing controversy.

Shaheen Afridi shrugs Suryakumar Yadav's 'no rivalry' take: We'll see in the final Shaheen Afridi shrugged off Suryakumar Yadav's "no rivalry" comments, insisting the real verdict will come if India and Pakistan meet in the Asia Cup final. India defeated Pakistan twice in the Asia Cup.

Hours before Test squad announcement, Prasidh retires hurt vs Australia A Pacer Prasidh Krishna was forced to leave the field on Wednesday after sustaining a concussion from a blow to his helmet while batting for India A against Australia A on day two of the second unofficial Test.

Abhishek Sharma solidifies top spot, Tilak, Suryakumar rise in T20I batting rankings India's Abhishek Sharma retains his top position in the ICC T20I batting rankings after impressive Asia Cup 2025 performances. Apart from him, captain Suryakumar Yadav and Tilak Varma also gained one spot each.

He emphasised the team's focus on cricket and their push for a place in the final amid ongoing controversy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
